comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Edgar himself was a French historian and intellectual: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edgar_Quinet. This evidently is a ship from the French Navy; more from google search: Part of the 1st Light Division which patrolled Otranto Straits. While in the Mediterranean she rescued 1200 people from Smyrna in 1922. Used as a training ship from 1925-27, she grounded herself on 4th January 1930 and sank on 9th.

comment._content: Two sets of three stacks - presumably widely separated boilers?
